page.title: 02GEOLOGY OF HENLLAN
page.content: The landscape and particularly the drainage of the block are greatly influenced by the geology. The rocks of this area were formed during the Palaeozoic era. In the east and north east are Carboniferous Limestone rocks which are tilted , dipping gently to the east. These rocks rest with unconformity on the Silurian rocks which underlie the remainder of the area. These are blue grey mudstones, siltstones and sandstones of the Elwy Group in the Ludlow Series.Their structure is more complicated with the finer grained rocks cleaved as well as being faulted and folded. The main fault is the Cefn Fault which runs from North to South in the centre of the area. This was formed during the Hercynian Orogeny.
